alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving storm producing heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Lee and southwestern Chatham Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 242 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a slow moving thunderstorm over Goldston, or 8 miles northwest of Sanford. This storm was nearly stationary. Up to an inch of rain has already fallen. HAZARD...Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Pittsboro, Siler City, Goldston and Cumnock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
